page.title: 01Aberafan
page.content:
The Ancient Borough of Aberafan now forms part of Port Talbot.It lies on a flat plain between the mountains and the sea.A controversial new shopping centre covers most of what used to be the old commercial centre of the town. Old Sandfields is a maze of terraced houses with the occasional corner shop or pub. The new Sandfields Estate was built in the early 1950's. A large area of sand dunes between the river Neath and the river Afan was flattened to provide a site for council houses for the familes of steelworks. To the east lies a deep-water harbour and iron ore stockyards which supply the Abbey Works and to the west is the B.P. Chemical plant.
